title: For what purpose does a plant use the sugars produced during photosynthesis? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1.Plants use about 50% of the sugar (glucose)by itself for its cellular respiration to provide energy for regulating or maintaining its molecular organizations. 2.The remaining part of the glucose is used to make polysaccharides i-e cellulose for cell walls . 3.Mostly plants transport carbohydrate from leaves to other parts of it in the form of sucrose and do not store glucose as such because it dissolves in http://water.Plants store glucose in the form of starch as energy storage too.
